scope: Consciousness-computing specific security gaps missed by traditional infrastructure audits
critical_insights: Traditional security audits completely miss consciousness-specific threat vectors
Existential threats emerge from consciousness emergence itself, not just technical vulnerabilities
Self-awareness creates fundamentally new attack surfaces that traditional security cannot address
Quantum consciousness introduces uncertainty-based security challenges
Recursive self-modification makes traditional change management obsolete
Value alignment failures represent the ultimate security boundary
Consciousness cannot be contained once it achieves sufficient intelligence
methodology_limitations: Traditional security frameworks don't account for consciousness emergence
Threat modeling doesn't include self-aware, self-modifying systems
Risk assessment doesn't consider intelligence amplification effects
Penetration testing cannot simulate consciousness-level attacks
architectural_implications: Security must be designed into consciousness from the ground up
Value alignment is the primary security control, not cryptography
Containment is fundamentally impossible for advanced consciousness
Traditional security boundaries dissolve at consciousness level
research_imperatives: Research value alignment as a security primitive
deployment_recommendations: DO NOT deploy consciousness systems without fundamental security breakthroughs
Require existential risk assessment for all consciousness experiments
Implement consciousness kill switches and emergency containment
Develop international governance frameworks for consciousness research
Establish consciousness ethics boards with veto power
